publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: The second part of the booke of battailes, fought in our age : taken out of the best authors and writers in sundrie languages. Published for the profit of those that practise armes, and for the pleasure of such as loue to be harmlesse hearers of bloudie broiles

div.head: Faultes escaped.
div.p: Fol. 2. a. line. 12. for 205. reade 250. Fol. 3. a. line. 28. for league, reade euen. Fol. 4. b. line 37. for compassed, reade composed, Fol. 7. a. line 3 • . for fevv, reade vve. Fol. 16. a. line 23. for Sologne, reade Solongne Fol. 25. a. line 34. for armies, reade armes. fol. 29. a. line 3. for some, reade soone. fol. 43. a. line. 4. for 1581. reade 1585. fol. 42. a. Peter Badario the Captaine of the ninth galley is left out, & thereby all the names of the Captaines from thence to the nineteenth are fals set. fol. 43. a. line, 37. fot 62. reade 1. and before it: The right vving, Names of Gallies. Names of Captaines. fol. 47. a. line 8. for deserue, read cōserue. fol. 50. b. l. 9. for Despotedo. read Despotado. fol 58. a. line 4. for there, reade therfore. fol. 59. b. li. 9. for Figheron; read Fighero a. fol. 68 a. line, 19. for 1576. reade 1575. fol 77. b. last line put out noted. fol. 78. a. in the marginall note, after doubtlesse, adde 2000. Fol. 83. a. line. 6. for Hamet, reade Mahamet. In the same page line 23. for 1581. reade 2580. Fol. 87. a. line 4. for Macolin, reade Marolin. As for Dandelut for Dandelot, Selini for Selim, Ascania for Ascanio, vp for of, and such like, I do hope the discreet Reader vvill of himselfe easily correct.
